awards: [{'title': 'Finalist - UK Maritime Masters Award', 'description': 'The Maritime Masters programme aims to encourage engagement and strengthen ties between the UK’s maritime industries and academia. The programme promotes academic excellence among students, whilst providing valuable insight into the most recent research that will be supporting the work of the entire maritime sector.', 'issuer': 'Maritime UK in collaboration with Clarksons Platou and Royal HaskoningDHV', 'date': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, {'title': 'Chevening Scholar', 'description': 'Chevening Scholarships is funded by the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO) and partner organisations.  The Chevening Award provides the opportunity for an international student to pursue a Master degree in a prestigious UK university.  Only 2%-3% from hundred thousand applicants are selected each year for the award. ', 'issuer': 'Chevening Scholarships, the UK Government’s Global Scholarship Programme', 'date': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, {'title': 'Undergraduate Scholar under RRA Science Side Related Subject', 'description': None, 'issuer': 'Government of Mauritius', 'date': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, {'title': 'Volvo Young Environmentalist Award', 'description': "In the late '90s, a marine science research and educational programme (Shoals of Capricorn) was implemented in Rodrigues by the Royal Society, Royal Geographical Society and the Institute of British Geographers. During my apprenticeship, I was nominated to represent the island and Shoals Rodrigues in Sweden for the Volvo Ocean Adventure competition where I was awarded the prestigious ‘Volvo Young Environmentalist Award’.
